intro: Mananthes latiflora, commonly known as broadleaf mannanthe, is a perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features large, heart-shaped leaves that are typically 5 to 10 inches in diameter. It produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Its fibrous roots and woody stems make it a hardy plant adapted to wetland environments.
